snippet: Guinea-Bissau, the West African country taken over by its military in April, now appears to be a place where drug trafficking is approved at the top, drug trade experts say.
abstract: “Sizable increase in drug trafficking in Guinea-Bissau since military coup has raised suspicions that military brass controlling country are in control of drug racket;” international counternarcotics experts say nation is now top narco-state in Africa, despite denials from country’s figurehead civilian government and its military leadership.
lead_paragraph: Guinea-Bissau, the West African country taken over by its military in April, now appears to be a place where drug trafficking is approved at the top, drug trade experts say.

headline.seo: Guinea-Bissau, After Coup, Is Drug-Trafficking Haven
headline.main: Leader Ousted, Nation Is Now a Drug Haven
headline.print_headline: Leader Ousted, Nation Is Now A Drug Haven

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
